headline: Stanley Black And Decker Faces Soft Quarter As Turnaround Plan Progresses
summary: Stanley Black & Decker (NYSE:SWK) reported weaker fourth quarter results, with revenue and organic growth coming in below expectations. Management cited soft retail demand and price sensitive consumers as key headwinds for the tools and outdoor business. The company outlined ongoing cost reduction efforts and plans for major product launches and supply chain changes to support future growth plans. For context, NYSE:SWK last closed at $91.06, with the share price up 8.7% over the past 30...
